page.title: 06UKRAINIAN CLUB, STOCKPORT
page.content: There are about 300 Ukrainians in the area. There are 70-80 male and 10 female members of the club, who enjoy {folk dancing,}keep-fit and sport events. You have to be over 18 to join but infants go along on Saturday mornings. The{Christmas traditions}are very different from our own. There is no Nativity play but a play called "Vertep". They eat a 12 dish meal on January 6th - their Christmas Eve. Then the children hang out pillow cases and their Christmas lasts 12 days. In the Ukraine today,there are about 50 millon people. The Ukrainians came to Britain during the second World War and did not go back. The women arrived after being in slave labour in Germany.The club allows the Ukrainians to keep their language and customs.
